result.execSummary:
The defendant William T Thomas was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
On Count #1 of Case 22CF169, the Court IMPOSES 90 days jail, consecutive, with Huber, forthwith;  the Court STAYS this sentence and places the Defendant on Probation for 2 years. Defendant is required to report for commencement and service of jail sentence with absolute sobriety and without non-prescribed controlled substances in his/her system.  Non-compliance will result in loss of Huber/work-release privileges without further process.
Consecutive to:

miscConds.notes:
Separate from the conditions of Probation, the Court orders payment of costs, fees and surcharges through the Clerk of Courts Office. [Clerk calculates this total to be:$543] The Court grants the Defendant sixty days to either pay the amount in full or to establish a payment plan with the Clerk of Courts Office.  Non-payment will result in 11  days in Jail with Huber privileges, consecutive.

**10/13/22: Per Court's order at sentencing and Attorney Huebner's Final Statement of Hours, Defendant to reimburse attorney fees in the amount of $153, in addition to attorney fees assessed on original Judgment of Conviction.**

--maintain absolute sobriety

--no presence in bars, taverns, or liquor stores

--no acts or threats of violence

--comply with any additional assessment and treatment of any kind as requested by Agent

--contact with Victims only as agreed to by express written consent of Victim 1 and Agent

--successful completion of Veterans treatment court program. Upon successful completion of the program, State agrees to not oppose any petition for early termination of probation that may be brought by DOC

--to comply with DNA sample provision

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

w/ elements and ccs

[ma] Cases 22CF169 & 22CF175 called at 3:37pm 
Defendant William T Thomas in court.  Attorney Karl E Huebner in court for William T Thomas.  Attorney Jeffrey Shock in court for State of Wisconsin. 

Maximum penalties are recited; Constitutional rights are reviewed; plea of " NO CONTEST " entered on Count #1 of Case 22CF169 and Count #1 of Case 22CF175; factual basis stipulated; victim rights compliance is verified.  The Court accepts the pleas.

As to Case 22CF169: The Court finds the Defendant guilty and orders Judgment of Conviction entered.

On Motion of the State, the Court reads-in and dismisses Count #2 of Case 22CF169.

On Count #1 of Case 22CF169, the Court IMPOSES 90 days jail, consecutive, with Huber, forthwith;  the Court STAYS this sentence and places the Defendant on Probation for 2 years, with conditions:
--maintain absolute sobriety
--no presence in bars, taverns, or liquor stores
--no acts or threats of violence
--comply with any additional assessment and treatment of any kind as requested by Agent
--contact with Victims only as agreed to by express written consent of Victim 1 and Agent
--successful completion of Veterans treatment court program. Upon successful completion of the program, State agrees to not oppose any petition for early termination of probation that may be brought by DOC
--to comply with DNA sample provision 

Separate from the conditions of Probation, the Court orders payment of costs, fees and surcharges through the Clerk of Courts Office. [Clerk calculates this total to be:$543] The Court grants the Defendant sixty days to either pay the amount in full or to establish a payment plan with the Clerk of Courts Office.  Non-payment will result in 11  days in Jail with Huber privileges, consecutive.  

Days credit for time already served:  3  days

Mr. Thomas is to report to Probation by noon tomorrow.

As to Case 22CF175: The Court STAYS entry of Judgment for 36 months, and adopts the Deferred Prosecution Agreement. 

Days credit for time already served:  5  days
recess: 4:04pm
The Court will address on 10/4 @ 3:00
SCRAM Failure to pay.

[MK; Appearances are by Zoom Conference] 
case called at 11:30am 
Defendant William T Thomas appears. Attorney Karl E Huebner appears. ADA Jeffrey Shock appears for the State of Wisconsin. 
J. Reinke from WCS is present. 
This hearing is scheduled on the WCS 8/9/22 letter-notice regarding non-payment of  Scram program fees.
The Court verifies with Mr. Thomas that he can see and hear the proceedings through the Zoom video-connection. 
Mr. Reinke provides an update that the current balance due is $ 570, and that the last payment received was $42 on 5/19/22.
Mr. Thomas indicates that he intends to pay the $570 amount in full today or by tomorrow at the latest. 
The Court requires Mr. Thomas to make the payment by end of business on August 24th.  The Court directs Mr. Reinke to submit a letter thereafter confirming receipt of the payment. 
recess 11:33am 

NEXT:  the October 4th Status Conference remains on the Court's calendar

In both cases Mr. Thomas waives his right to Preliminary Hearings; the Court accepts this waiver and binds him over for Trials.

--pleas of "not guilty" are entered
--in response to the Court's inquiry, both counsel indicate that they are not requesting speedy trials.

records.addlTxt:
[ml] Cases 22CF169 and 22CF175 called at 1:31PM
Defendant William T Thomas appears in court. Public Service Special Prosecutor Melanie Flint appears for the State of Wisconsin. 
The Defendant verifies that he has received a copy of the Criminal Complaint.
The Defendant advises that he has not applied for County appointed counsel. The Court informs the Defendant of his right to an attorney, and instructs the Defendant to appear before Room 115 of the Jefferson County Courthouse to acquire, complete, and submit a Petition for a Court Appointed Attorney.
The Court sets these files over for a Status of Counsel hearing.

The Defendant requests that the Court modify the bond for reasons stated on the record.
A victim present makes a statement.
The Court declines to modify bond for reasons stated on the record. The Court advises that the Defendant may raise this issue at the next scheduled hearing when the Defendant has counsel.

recess 1:42PM

NEXT: Status Conference (also Status of Counsel) on 05/01 at 1:15PM with in person

AMENDED

[ma] Cases 22CF175 & 22CF169 called at 1:34 PM 
Defendant William T Thomas appears via videoconferencing from the Jefferson County Jail, in custody, along with Public Defender Amber Rumpf (PD appears for bond-purposes only--additional information needed).  ADA Theresa Beck appears for the State of Wisconsin. 

Victim 1 of Case 22CF169 and Representative of Vetran Affairs present in courtroom gallery

Initial Appearance occurs in Case 22CF175:
The Defendant verifies that the date of birth and address listed on the Criminal Complaint are correct. 
Service of Complaint admitted, reading waived, the charges and maximum penalties are recited.
Right to Counsel reviewed

The Court tolls Preliminary Hearing time limits.

Bond Arguments given by Counsel

The Court requires a $500  Signature Bond with conditions:
--maintain absolute sobriety
--no possession or consumption of alcohol
--no possession or ingestion of controlled substances without a valid prescription
--to take prescription medications only as prescribed
--The Defendant is to report and comply with SCRAM alcohol monitoring program as administered by Wisconsin Community Services.  The Court orders the defendant to SCRAM monitoring through WCS, with the consideration of Remote Breath as an alternative only when WCS verifies that a defendant's work environment or health condition prohibits the SCRAM bracelet.

The Defendant is to comply with all SCRAM Program conditions of participation including payment of program costs and fees.   **If in custody, release on SCRAM only.**

As to Case 22CF169:
Victim 1 makes statement to Court, request for specific bond conditions

The Court addresses Victim 1

Per the request of Victim 1, the Court allows text message contact/communication with Victim 1, but there is to be no discussion of the case and no harrassing context. 
recess 1:51  pm. 

NEXT: Status Conference on 4/20/22 at 1:15pm
Scheduling Order
Status conference on April 20, 2022 at 01:15 pm.
Order to Seal Victim Key

[ma] Case called at 2:05pm 
Defendant William T Thomas appears via videoconferencing from the Jefferson County Jail, in custody, along with Public Defender Cassi Nelson and Kayla Barteck(PD appears for bond-purposes only).  ADA Michael Witt appears for the State of Wisconsin. 

The Court finds that the video-connection is sight and sound sufficient. 

The Defendant verifies that the date of birth and address listed on the Criminal Complaint are correct. 
Service of Complaint admitted, reading waived, the charges and maximum penalties are recited.

Bond Arguments given by Counsel

The Court requires a $5000  Signature Bond with conditions:
--no acts or threats of violence
--no contact with Victim 1, Victim 2, or Witness 1
--maintain absolute sobriety 
--no presence in bars, taverns, liquor stores
--to take medications only as prescribed
**Mr. Thomas is allowed one return to the residence with escort of law enforcement to retrieve what is personally and legally his, law enforecement is to allow no less than one hour.
